prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Top Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. Begin by creating a new coordinate system, using the Euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.25, and 0.0. This will position the base of the shape at the specified Z-coordinate, with the specified rotations applied. Create the first face of the sketch, consisting of the following four lines: 1. Line 1: Connect the points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.0) in the XY-plane. 2. Line 2: Connect the points (0.75, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.5) in the XY-plane. 3. Line 3: Connect the points (0.75, 0.5) and (0.0, 0.5) in the XY-plane. 4. Line 4: Connect the points (0.0, 0.5) and (0.0, 0.0) in the XY-plane. To transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, apply the following rotation and translation vector: 1. Rotation: Apply the specified euler angles (0.0, 0.0, and -90.0) to rotate the sketch. 2. Translation Vector: Apply the translation vector (-0.0, 0.25, and 0.0) to the sketch. Extrude the sketch by the depth value of 0.125 towards the normal direction and 0.125 in the opposite direction of the normal, using the specified scaling factor (0.75). This completes the first part of the CAD assembly. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Cutout Create a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system, using the Euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.375, 0.25, and 0.125. This will position the base of the shape at the specified Z-coordinate, with the specified rotations applied. Create the first face of the sketch, consisting of the following three lines: 1. Line 1: Connect the points (0.0, 0.375) and (0.375, 0.0) in the XY-plane. 2. Line 2: Connect the points (0.375, 0.0) and (0.375, 0.375) in the XY-plane. 3. Line 3: Connect the points (0.375, 0.375) and (0.0, 0.375) in the XY-plane. To transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, apply the following rotation and translation vector: 1. Rotation: Apply the specified euler angles (0.0, 0.0, and -90.0) to rotate the sketch. 2. Translation Vector: Apply the translation vector (-0.0, 0.25, and 0.0) to the sketch. Extrude the sketch by the depth value of 0.0625 towards the normal direction and 0.0625 in the opposite direction of the normal, using the specified scaling factor (0.375). This completes the second part of the CAD assembly. The final CAD assembly consists of these two parts. The first part, a three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, is joined to the second part, a rectangular prism with a cutout, following the rules outlined in the JSON file.</description>

</json>

Close the loop by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.3612] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Next, we need to scale the 2D sketch. Use a scaling factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector in the coordinate system. Now, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.0438 units and opposite normal by 0 units to create the 3D model. Apply a sketch scale factor of 0.75. This new body is the first intermediate CAD part in our final shape. Dimensions of this part: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0438 - Height: 0.75 Please provide the JSON for the next part(s) if applicable.</description>

Extrusion: Extrude the sketch using the given parameters: - Extrude the sketch by approximately 0.4286 units in the normal direction and 0 units in the opposite normal direction. - Apply a scaling factor of 0.4286 to the sketch before extrusion. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Construct the second part by generating a coordinate system with the given Euler angles and translation vector. Then, follow these instructions to create the sketch and extrusion: 1. Sketch: Start a new sketch on the XY plane (face\\_1) and perform the following operations: - Loop 1: First, create a line (line\\_1) from point (0.2143, 0) to point (0.75, 0). Then, create an arc (arc\\_1) from point (0.75, 0) to point (0.2143, 0) with the midpoint at (0.4286, 0.2143). - Loop 2: Create a circle (circle\\_1) with the center at (0.2143, 0.2143) and a radius of 0.1071. 2. Extrusion: Extrude the sketch using the given parameters: - Extrude the sketch by approximately 0.0804 units in the normal and opposite normal directions. - Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch before extrusion. Part 3: Rectangular Prism Build the third part by generating a coordinate system with the provided Euler angles and translation vector. Then, follow these instructions to create the sketch and extrusion: 1. Sketch: Start a new sketch on the XY plane (face\\_1) and perform these operations: - Loop 1: Create a rectangle by drawing three lines: - Line 1: From (0, 0) to (0.2143, 0) - Line 2: From (0.2143, 0) to (0.2143, 0.2143) - Line 3: From (0.2143, 0.2143) to (0, 0) 2. Extrusion: Extrude the sketch using the given parameters: - Extrude the sketch by approximately 0.1071 units in the normal and opposite normal directions. - Apply a scaling factor of 0.2143 to the sketch before extrusion. The final shape consists of the three parts combined, resulting in a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved side and a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole. Keep in mind that the given instructions are based on the provided JSON data, and any additional assumptions or adjustments might be necessary for the actual CAD modeling process.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a cutout on one of its faces** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.0, 0.0175, 0.0 ] Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system.
